boot.initrd.systemd.users.<name>.group.name: boot.initrd.systemd.users.<name>.group
boot.initrd.systemd.users.<name>.group.description: Group the user belongs to in initrd.

services.lshd.loginShell.name: services.lshd.loginShell
services.lshd.loginShell.description: If non-null, override the default login shell with the specified value.

services.home-assistant.config.homeassis.name: services.home-assistant.config.homeassistant.time_zone
services.home-assistant.config.homeassis.description: Pick your time zone from the column TZ of Wikipedia’s list of tz database time zones.

systemd.user.timers.<name>.wants.name: systemd.user.timers.<name>.wants
systemd.user.timers.<name>.wants.description: Start the specified units when this unit is started.
systemd.user.timers.<name>.wants.option_type: list of string matching the pattern [a-zA-Z0-9@%:_.\-]+[.](service|socket|device|mount|automount|swap|target|path|timer|scope|slice)

services.iptsd.config.Touch.DisableOnPal.name: services.iptsd.config.Touch.DisableOnPalm
services.iptsd.config.Touch.DisableOnPal.description: Ignore all touch inputs if a palm was registered on the display.

services.kasmweb.networkSubnet.name: services.kasmweb.networkSubnet
services.kasmweb.networkSubnet.description: The network subnet to use for the containers.

systemd.user.services.<name>.startLimitI.name: systemd.user.services.<name>.startLimitIntervalSec
systemd.user.services.<name>.startLimitI.description: Configure unit start rate limiting. Units which are started more than startLimitBurst times within an interval time interval are not permitted to start any more.

services.nextcloud.config.dbport.name: services.nextcloud.config.dbport
services.nextcloud.config.dbport.option_type: null or signed integer or string

services.minidlna.settings.friendly_name.name: services.minidlna.settings.friendly_name
services.minidlna.settings.friendly_name.description: Name that the DLNA server presents to clients.

services.oauth2_proxy.proxyPrefix.name: services.oauth2_proxy.proxyPrefix
services.oauth2_proxy.proxyPrefix.description: The url root path that this proxy should be nested under.

systemd.timers.<name>.description.name: systemd.timers.<name>.description
systemd.timers.<name>.description.description: Description of this unit used in systemd messages and progress indicators.

networking.dhcpcd.IPv6rs.name: networking.dhcpcd.IPv6rs
networking.dhcpcd.IPv6rs.description: Force enable or disable solicitation and receipt of IPv6 Router Advertisements. This is required, for example, when using a static unique local IPv6 address (ULA) and global IPv6 address auto-configuration with SLAAC.

services.openssh.startWhenNeeded.name: services.openssh.startWhenNeeded
services.openssh.startWhenNeeded.description: If set, {command}sshd is socket-activated; that is, instead of having it permanently running as a daemon, systemd will start an instance for each incoming connection.

networking.wg-quick.interfaces.<name>.li.name: networking.wg-quick.interfaces.<name>.listenPort
networking.wg-quick.interfaces.<name>.li.description: 16-bit port for listening. Optional; if not specified, automatically generated based on interface name.

services.xtreemfs.dir.extraConfig.name: services.xtreemfs.dir.extraConfig
services.xtreemfs.dir.extraConfig.description: Configuration of XtreemFS DIR service. WARNING: configuration is saved as plaintext inside nix store. For more options: https://www.xtreemfs.org/xtfs-guide-1.5.1/index.html
services.xtreemfs.dir.extraConfig.example:
''
  # specify whether SSL is required
  ssl.enabled = true
  ssl.service_creds.pw = passphrase
  ssl.service_creds.container = pkcs12
  ssl.service_creds = /etc/xos/xtreemfs/truststore/certs/dir.p12
  ssl.trusted_certs = /etc/xos/xtreemfs/truststore/certs/trusted.jks
  ssl.trusted_certs.pw = jks_passphrase
  ssl.trusted_certs.container = jks
''

services.jibri.controlDomain.name: services.jibri.controlDomain
services.jibri.controlDomain.description: Domain part of the JID for control connection.

boot.initrd.luks.devices.<name>.bypassWo.name: boot.initrd.luks.devices.<name>.bypassWorkqueues
boot.initrd.luks.devices.<name>.bypassWo.description: Whether to bypass dm-crypt's internal read and write workqueues. Enabling this should improve performance on SSDs; see here for more information. Needs Linux 5.9 or later.

services.spiped.config.<name>.maxConns.name: services.spiped.config.<name>.maxConns
services.spiped.config.<name>.maxConns.description: Limit on the number of simultaneous connections allowed.

services.prometheus.exporters.shelly.ope.name: services.prometheus.exporters.shelly.openFirewall
services.prometheus.exporters.shelly.ope.description: Open port in firewall for incoming connections.

programs.extra-container.enable.name: programs.extra-container.enable
programs.extra-container.enable.description: Whether to enable extra-container, a tool for running declarative NixOS containers without host system rebuilds .

services.lldap.settings.ldap_port.name: services.lldap.settings.ldap_port
services.lldap.settings.ldap_port.description: The port on which to have the LDAP server.
services.lldap.settings.ldap_port.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

services.coturn.static-auth-secret-file.name: services.coturn.static-auth-secret-file
services.coturn.static-auth-secret-file.description: Path to the file containing the static authentication secret.

services.tt-rss.database.port.name: services.tt-rss.database.port
services.tt-rss.database.port.description: The database's port. If not set, the default ports will be provided (5432 and 3306 for pgsql and mysql respectively).
services.tt-rss.database.port.option_type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.basic.name: services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.basicAuthFile
services.nginx.virtualHosts.<name>.basic.description:
Basic Auth password file for a vhost. Can be created via: <command>htpasswd -c <filename> <username></command>.

WARNING: The generate file contains the users' passwords in a non-cryptographically-securely hashed way.

services.apache-kafka.configFiles.server.name: services.apache-kafka.configFiles.serverProperties
services.apache-kafka.configFiles.server.description: Kafka server.properties configuration file path. Defaults to the rendered settings.

services.bookstack.nginx.listenAddresses.name: services.bookstack.nginx.listenAddresses
services.bookstack.nginx.listenAddresses.description:
Listen addresses for this virtual host. Compared to listen this only sets the addresses and the ports are chosen automatically.

Note: This option overrides enableIPv6

security.doas.extraRules.name: security.doas.extraRules
security.doas.extraRules.description: Define specific rules to be set in the {file}/etc/doas.conf file. More specific rules should come after more general ones in order to yield the expected behavior. You can use mkBefore and/or mkAfter to ensure this is the case when configuration options are merged. Be aware that this option cannot be used to override the behaviour allowing passwordless operation for root.

services.samba.enable.name: services.samba.enable
services.samba.enable.description:
Whether to enable Samba, which provides file and print services to Windows clients through the SMB/CIFS protocol.

::: {.note} If you use the firewall consider adding the following:

services.samba.openFirewall = true;

:::

services.znc.confOptions.useSSL.name: services.znc.confOptions.useSSL
services.znc.confOptions.useSSL.description: Indicates whether the ZNC server should use SSL when listening on the specified port. A self-signed certificate will be generated.

services.webhook.hooksTemplated.name: services.webhook.hooksTemplated
services.webhook.hooksTemplated.description:
Same as {option}hooks, but these hooks are specified as literal strings instead of Nix values, and hence can include template syntax which might not be representable as JSON.

Template syntax requires the {option}enableTemplates option to be set to true, which is done by default if this option is set.

services.buildbot-master.packages.name: services.buildbot-master.packages
services.buildbot-master.packages.description: Packages to add to PATH for the buildbot process.

flyingcircus.services.sensu-client.check.name: flyingcircus.services.sensu-client.checks.<name>.interval
flyingcircus.services.sensu-client.check.description: The interval (in seconds) how often this check should be performed.

services.etcd.initialAdvertisePeerUrls.name: services.etcd.initialAdvertisePeerUrls
services.etcd.initialAdvertisePeerUrls.description: Etcd list of this member's peer URLs to advertise to rest of the cluster.

services.geoclue2.enable.name: services.geoclue2.enable
services.geoclue2.enable.description: Whether to enable GeoClue 2 daemon, a DBus service that provides location information for accessing.

services.thanos.query-frontend.grpc-serv.name: services.thanos.query-frontend.grpc-server-tls-key
services.thanos.query-frontend.grpc-serv.description: TLS Key for the gRPC server, leave blank to disable TLS

services.prometheus.exporters.process.ex.name: services.prometheus.exporters.process.extraFlags
services.prometheus.exporters.process.ex.description: Extra commandline options to pass to the process exporter.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.extraCon.name: services.limesurvey.virtualHost.extraConfig
services.limesurvey.virtualHost.extraCon.description: These lines go to httpd.conf verbatim. They will go after directories and directory aliases defined by default.

systemd.services.<name>.stopIfChanged.name: systemd.services.<name>.stopIfChanged
systemd.services.<name>.stopIfChanged.description: If set, a changed unit is restarted by calling {command}systemctl stop in the old configuration, then {command}systemctl start in the new one. Otherwise, it is restarted in a single step using {command}systemctl restart in the new configuration. The latter is less correct because it runs the ExecStop commands from the new configuration.

services.slurm.clusterName.name: services.slurm.clusterName
services.slurm.clusterName.description: Necessary to distinguish accounting records in a multi-cluster environment.

services.xserver.inputClassSections.name: services.xserver.inputClassSections
services.xserver.inputClassSections.description: Content of additional InputClass sections of the X server configuration file.
services.xserver.inputClassSections.example:
[ ''
    Identifier      "Trackpoint Wheel Emulation"
    MatchProduct    "ThinkPad USB Keyboard with TrackPoint"
    Option          "EmulateWheel"          "true"
    Option          "EmulateWheelButton"    "2"
    Option          "Emulate3Buttons"       "false"
  ''
]

services.rshim.enable.name: services.rshim.enable
services.rshim.enable.description: Whether to enable user-space rshim driver for the BlueField SoC.

services.monero.limits.syncSize.name: services.monero.limits.syncSize
services.monero.limits.syncSize.description: Maximum number of blocks to sync at once. Set to 0 for adaptive.

services.matomo.hostname.name: services.matomo.hostname
services.matomo.hostname.description: URL of the host, without https prefix. You may want to change it if you run Matomo on a different URL than matomo.yourdomain.

services.authelia.instances.<name>.setti.name: services.authelia.instances.<name>.settings.log.keep_stdout
services.authelia.instances.<name>.setti.description: Whether to also log to stdout when a file_path is defined.

services.matomo.nginx.useACMEHost.name: services.matomo.nginx.useACMEHost
services.matomo.nginx.useACMEHost.description:
A host of an existing Let's Encrypt certificate to use. This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the

<link xlink:href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits/">rate limit</link>. Alternately, you can generate a certificate through <option>enableACME</option>. <emphasis>Note that this option does not create any certificates, nor it does add subdomains to existing ones – you will need to create them manually using <xref linkend="opt-security.acme.certs"/>.</emphasis>

services.kubernetes.masterAddress.name: services.kubernetes.masterAddress
services.kubernetes.masterAddress.description: Clusterwide available network address or hostname for the kubernetes master server.

services.chrony.servers.name: services.chrony.servers
services.chrony.servers.description: The set of NTP servers from which to synchronise.

systemd.network.config.addRouteTablesToI.name: systemd.network.config.addRouteTablesToIPRoute2
systemd.network.config.addRouteTablesToI.description: If true and routeTables are set, then the specified route tables will also be installed into /etc/iproute2/rt_tables.

services._3proxy.services.*.acl.*.target.name: services._3proxy.services.*.acl.*.targets
services._3proxy.services.*.acl.*.target.description: List of target IP ranges, use empty list for any. May also contain host names instead of addresses. It's possible to use wildmask in the beginning and in the the end of hostname, e.g. *badsite.com or *badcontent*. Hostname is only checked if hostname presents in request.

services.thanos.query.endpoints.name: services.thanos.query.endpoints
services.thanos.query.endpoints.description:
Addresses of statically configured Thanos API servers (repeatable).

The scheme may be prefixed with 'dns+' or 'dnssrv+' to detect Thanos API servers through respective DNS lookups.

services.postfix.enable.name: services.postfix.enable
services.postfix.enable.description: Whether to run the Postfix mail server.

security.pam.enableOTPW.name: security.pam.enableOTPW
security.pam.enableOTPW.description: Whether to enable the OTPW (one-time password) PAM module.

services.prometheus.exporters.buildkite-.name: services.prometheus.exporters.buildkite-agent.openFirewall
services.prometheus.exporters.buildkite-.description: Open port in firewall for incoming connections.

services.tor.settings.SOCKSPort.name: services.tor.settings.SOCKSPort
services.tor.settings.SOCKSPort.option_type: list of (16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive) or (submodule))

mailserver.fullTextSearch.memoryLimit.name: mailserver.fullTextSearch.memoryLimit
mailserver.fullTextSearch.memoryLimit.description: Memory limit for the indexer process, in MiB. If null, leaves the default (which is rather low), and if 0, no limit.

users.mysql.pam.logging.table.name: users.mysql.pam.logging.table
users.mysql.pam.logging.table.description: The name of the table to which logs are written.

services.elasticsearch.port.name: services.elasticsearch.port
services.elasticsearch.port.description: Elasticsearch port to listen for HTTP traffic.
services.elasticsearch.port.option_type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

services.cassandra.jmxPort.name: services.cassandra.jmxPort
services.cassandra.jmxPort.description: Specifies the default port over which Cassandra will be available for JMX connections. For security reasons, you should not expose this port to the internet. Firewall it if needed.

services.undervolt.useTimer.name: services.undervolt.useTimer
services.undervolt.useTimer.description: Whether to set a timer that applies the undervolt settings every 30s. This will cause spam in the journal but might be required for some hardware under specific conditions. Enable this if your undervolt settings don't hold.

boot.initrd.network.flushBeforeStage2.name: boot.initrd.network.flushBeforeStage2
boot.initrd.network.flushBeforeStage2.description:
Whether to clear the configuration of the interfaces that were set up in the initrd right before stage 2 takes over. Stage 2 will do the regular network configuration based on the NixOS networking options.

The default is false when systemd is enabled in initrd, because the systemd-networkd documentation suggests it.

services.prometheus.exporters.unpoller.e.name: services.prometheus.exporters.unpoller.enable
services.prometheus.exporters.unpoller.e.description: Whether to enable the prometheus unpoller exporter.

system.autoUpgrade.allowReboot.name: system.autoUpgrade.allowReboot
system.autoUpgrade.allowReboot.description: Reboot the system into the new generation instead of a switch if the new generation uses a different kernel, kernel modules or initrd than the booted system. See {option}rebootWindow for configuring the times at which a reboot is allowed.

programs.gnupg.package.name: programs.gnupg.package
programs.gnupg.package.description: The gpg package that should be used.

services.consul.extraConfigFiles.name: services.consul.extraConfigFiles
services.consul.extraConfigFiles.description: Additional configuration files to pass to consul NOTE: These will not trigger the service to be restarted when altered.

flyingcircus.roles.jitsi.coturn.enable.name: flyingcircus.roles.jitsi.coturn.enable
flyingcircus.roles.jitsi.coturn.enable.description: Whether to enable Enable a local coturn preconfigured for Jitsi Machines with Jitsi and a local coturn need two public IP addresses. .

networking.bonds.<name>.xmit_hash_policy.name: networking.bonds.<name>.xmit_hash_policy
networking.bonds.<name>.xmit_hash_policy.description: DEPRECATED, use driverOptions. Selects the transmit hash policy to use for slave selection in balance-xor, 802.3ad, and tlb modes.

services.snipe-it.nginx.locations.<name>.name: services.snipe-it.nginx.locations.<name>.proxyWebsockets
services.snipe-it.nginx.locations.<name>.description: Whether to support proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.
